notesStmt.note: Ya῾aḳov ben Mordekhai: sold to Yeḥiel ben Uri on 28 of the month Iyyar 229 Hebrew[1469Gregorian]: inscribed in a purchase note (folio 358v). Italian and French translation of the same purchase note on a paper leaf foliated and presently part of quire xxii (dated 1824) (folio 359v). Italian insrciption: 'Questo libro .. venduto nel 28 Ijar 5229' (18th-19th century) (folio 360r). English description of the manuscript, in pencil, partially illegible (19th century?) (folio 1r).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch (aka the 'Duke of Sussex's German Pentateuch') with Targum Onḳelos, small pieces on the feasts, Five Scrolls and Hafṭarot, accompanied by masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 32 quires: i13+1, ii12, iii12, iv8, v8, vi8, vii8, viii8, ix8, x8, xi8, xii8, xiii12, xiv16, xv12, xvi16, xvii16, xviii12, xix12, xx16, xxi10, xxii16, xxiii14, xxiv8, xxv12, xxvi8, xxvii16, xxviii8, xxix12, xxx12, xxxi12, xxxii9+2. Quires marked by catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Main text in Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, punctuated; masoretic notes in Ashkenazi semi-cursive, not punctuated, of the 14th century. Ḥayim, inscribed with his name (folios 313v, 358r); the word חיים is marked on folio 244v).

decoDesc.decoNote: 1v 75v 137r 179v 238r Full-page miniature with initial word panel.
Small lion in ink in the upper corner of the page.

binding.p: Pre-1600. 16th-century gold-tooled Venetian binding. Spine: 'Pentateuch. Hebrew & Aramaic. Brit. Mus. Additional 15,282.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Prince Augustus Frederick (b. 1773, d. 1843), duke of Sussex: his armorial book-plate, inscribed 'VI. H. C. 2', and above the book-plate 'Sec. xiii. B.S. Vol. I, Part I, p. xiv, no. 3' (inside upper cover); his sale 2 August 1844, lot 313: inscribed, folio 360v, purchased by the British Museum through Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849) for £111.
